meanings.definition: Situated on or relating to the side or surface of an organ or structure that is facing away from the midline of the body.
meanings.sent1: The ventrolateral fins of the fish help it maintain balance in the water.
meanings.sent2: The scientist pointed to the ventrolateral part of the brain during the anatomy class.
meanings.sent3: The ventrolateral stripes on the zebra made it look like it was wearing suspenders.
meanings.sent4: The ventrolateral position of the satellite allowed for a clear view of the Earth.
meanings.sent5: The ventrolateral markings on the butterfly's wings were vibrant and eye-catching.

meanings.definition: Located on or toward the side of an animal or plant that is closest to the ground or surface.
meanings.sent1: The ventrolateral roots of the tree spread out to anchor it firmly in the soil.
meanings.sent2: The ventrolateral leaves of the plant received ample sunlight for photosynthesis.
meanings.sent3: The ventrolateral branches of the tree seemed to be reaching out for a hug.
meanings.sent4: The ventrolateral position of the squirrel on the tree trunk made it hard to spot.
meanings.sent5: The ventrolateral growth of the vine covered the entire fence with lush greenery.
